fields.description: Contains additional information about the issue, such as a list of items to fix.
fields.name: AdditionalInformation

fields.description: The date and time when the health issue was generated. The timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z.
fields.name: CreatedDateTime

fields.description: Contains more detailed information about the health issue.
fields.name: Description

fields.description: The display name of the health issue.
fields.name: DisplayName

fields.description: A list of the fully qualified domain names of the domains or the sensors the health issue is related to.
fields.name: DomainNames

fields.description: The type of the health issue. The possible values are: sensor, global, unknownFutureValue. For a list of all health issues and their identifiers, see Microsoft Defender for Identity health issues.
fields.name: HealthIssueType

fields.description: The type identifier of the health issue. For a list of all health issues and their identifiers, see Microsoft Defender for Identity health issues.
fields.name: IssueTypeId

fields.description: The date and time when the health issue was last updated. The timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z.
fields.name: LastModifiedDateTime

fields.description: A list of recommended actions that can be taken to resolve the issue effectively and efficiently. These actions might include instructions for further investigation and aren't limited to prewritten responses.
fields.name: Recommendations

fields.description: A list of commands from the PowerShell module for the product that can be used to resolve the issue, if available. If no commands can be used to solve the issue, this property is empty. The commands, if present, provide a quick and efficient way to address the issue. These commands run in sequence for the single recommended fix.
fields.name: RecommendedActionCommands

fields.description: A list of the DNS names of the sensors the health issue is related to.
fields.name: SensorDNSNames

fields.description: The severity of the health issue. The possible values are: low, medium, high, unknownFutureValue.
fields.name: Severity

fields.description: The status of the health issue. The possible values are: open, closed, suppressed, unknownFutureValue.
fields.name: Status
